title: 1177-A
statement: A. Digits Sequence (Easy Edition)time limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputLet's write all the positive integer numbers one after another from $$$1$$$ without any delimiters (i.e. as a single string). It will be the infinite sequence starting with123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536...Your task is to print the $$$k$$$-th digit of this sequence.InputThe first and only line contains integer $$$k$$$ ($$$1 \\le k \\le 10000$$$) â€” the position to process ($$$1$$$-based index).OutputPrint the $$$k$$$-th digit of the resulting infinite sequence.ExamplesInput7Output7Input21Output5

processed.result:
You are given an integer $k$ ($1 \le k \le 10000$).  Find the $k$th digit in the following infinite sequence:

123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536... 

For example, the 7th digit is 7, and the 21st digit is 5.
Find the digit at a specific position in a sequence of all positive integers written one after another.
